column5: Finally went for some fishing today.  When we arrived, several people were already fishing.  They all said no fish all day.  We tried and same result as they had. At least we were able to see a "dying" Drum slowly cruising in circle close to shore.  Shoreline wild life is also a wonderful scene in a warm January ice free day   Ahhhhh that really cured my itching fingers~!!!!!
good stuff, gald ya got out,  where did u go?
Nice day to be out SteelCat.  To bad you didn't hook into any.  Keep at it, the weather sure is great for all us shore fisherman.  Corn Nug
Did you see two guys when you first got there one was wearing a blue and white GM coat on and I was in a Yellow. My Dad had an OFC touque on and I had my OFC had on.  BTW nice pictures.
I saw three people when I arrived, and definitly saw someone in Yellow was that you?

Great report!  Gotta love fishing this time of year....I figured I'd be done back in November....but I keep going out!  I got Christmas presents this year that I'm happy to say I've been able to use already!  Thanks for posting!
That's definately a drum.  Good try, nice to get out.

Hey Steelcat I did the same thing today but in downtown Montreal in the Old Port. Took a thermos of coffee and brought my folding chair. Who a thunk i'd be shore fishin' in Juneuarey!!!! managed to catch 5 perch and 2 walleye. 3 of the perch were fat porkers bigger than the walleye. Met a couple of guys and had a great day. Ya gotta love it!!

Oooo Old Port Montreal~  I was in Montreal for 5 years and never had a chance to fish there.  5 Perch and 2 Walleye is really some good fishing trip especially in January and around Montreal~! Thx for your report
